os.fullpath: Operating System :: Modern (Vendor-Supported) Desktop Operating Systems :: Linux

name: OCS Inventory Admin dump
short_description:
When running OCS Inventory, you may come across a situation where you need to "start over" and rebuild your OCS database from scratch. While your server agents will repopulate most of the data, there is no easy way to export and import your Administrative (or custom) data. This can be a deal-breaker for anyone who has custom info for hundreds of servers.

This script allows you to do the following:

-Dump all administrative data from your current database, storing the data in .csv files

-Restore that data after rebuilding your OCS database (whether via a database restore, or by waiting for your clients to check in again.)

-During the restore, you can see if any servers from the old instance are missing in the new instance, so that you won't have incomplete admin data.

Requires a Linux-based OCS Inventory server v. 2.0+, and a mysql database. Tested on Redhat 6 but should work on other distros.
summary: Helps you dump and restore Administrative data from OCS Inventory db
